speaker: MAN #1 ON TV
line: Hold, punster! Find the prisoner!

speaker: MAN #2 ON TV
line: Find the prisoner!

speaker: MAN #1 ON TV
line: There, there, whoa! Who's this?

speaker: MAN #3 ON TV
line: There, there's been a mistake. Get me a lawyer.

speaker: MAN #1 ON TV
line: Forward, punster. Where is the king?

speaker: MAN #4 ON TV
line: In the great hall, sire.

speaker: MAN #5 ON TV
line: Enough! My horses.

speaker: MAN #4 ON TV
line: Aye, sire.

speaker: MAN #5 ON TV
line: "Ode to the Great Hawk."

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: It can't be. No, no! Not again!

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Hello, Duane. Nice to see you.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Nice to see you too, Doc.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: How are you feeling today?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Pretty good.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Why don't we sit down, Duane? I want to go over a few things with you.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Okay.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Now, uh, it says here that you've been refusing to take your medicine.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I don't like the way it makes me feel.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Okay, all right, let's talk about that. Because we give you that medicine for a reason, Duane, because of your behavior.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I know, I know.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Because we don't want you to hurt anybody again. You're still hearing voices?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm not crazy, Doc. Duane Barry's not like these other guys.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: No, everybody here is different.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They're coming again. They're coming again, I can feel it. They're going to take Duane Barry to this place.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Nobody's coming, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Nobody can stop them.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: I'm going to give you a shot. I think you just need some rest. Now, this will make you sleep... and you'll wake up and you will see that we didn't let anybody hurt you. Okay, Duane? Duane? Duane!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Get away, get away.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Put the gun down, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Give me the keys.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Duane...

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Give me the damn keys!

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah, do it!

speaker: HAKKIE
line: No, no!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Either way, Doc, we're getting out of here together. You guys... let's do it now. Go! Go! Go!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Agent Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Krycek, what's up?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: There's a situation going down. They want you out there right away.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of situation?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hostage negotiation.

speaker: MULDER
line: And they want me?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: What for?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The guy escaped a mental institution. He's got four people at gunpoint in an office building. Claims he's being controlled by aliens.

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Stay back!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Krycek, Mulder, F.B.I. What's your handle?

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Right that way, sir.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: MAN #2
line: Okay, I've got it right here. Lucy?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Lucy Kazdin, negotiations commander. Thanks for coming.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Agent Krycek.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Let me show you what we've got. His name's Duane Barry. He's armed with a nine millimeter Smith & Wesson handgun, one nine-round magazine. It is our belief he's prepared to use the gun and not afraid to die.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does he want?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Safe passage for himself and his original hostage, a shrink named Hakkie.

speaker: MULDER
line: Passage to where?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: He's bent on taking the Doctor with him to an alien abduction site, only he can't quite remember where the site is so he stopped at a travel agency.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is he lucid?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Yes, but he's off his medication so he's manic, ranting about scoop mark scars on his body, homing devices, and a lot of other nonsense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like what?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: This whole alien abduction business, which I guess you know something about.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, yeah, but I've never been in a hostage negotiation before.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Oh, we'll take you through it. Agent Rich is our advisory commander. He and I will be coaching you.

speaker: RICH
line: What Mister Barry needs right now is a friend, someone who appears to understand him and can appeal to his sense of reason.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do we know anything about his abduction experiences?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: You really believe in this stuff, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that a problem?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: We're here to save lives. You'll begin negotiations immediately. Every three hours, we'll reevaluate your progress and let our tactical commander advise and update on the use of force.

speaker: MULDER
line: If this man is an abductee, I need to know more about him, his personal history. Each abduction case is different.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: That material's not been made available to us.

speaker: MULDER
line: And nobody's thought to call the hospital for records?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Look, Agent Mulder. The guy's a psycho. Your object is to keep him on the phone. The longer you do, the more chance he's not going to kill anybody. We stop to do a Freudian analysis, next thing we know, we've got four dead hostages. So whatever crap you got to make up about space men or UFOs, just keep him on the phone.

speaker: BOB
line: Are we going to have to sit like this all night?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I told you to shut up.

speaker: GWEN
line: We all have families, for God's sake.

speaker: HAKKIE
line: Duane? Don't hurt anyone. Please?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm not going to hurt you, Doc. Because this time, you're going with Duane Barry so you can see what it's like... that it's real!

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Yeah?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Special Agent Fox Mulder. Look, I want to try to help you.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Yeah? Well... we're just sitting here, waiting for, uh... travel plans.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I know what you're going through, Duane. I just want to make sure you get what you want and that... Bob, Kimberly and Gwen and Doctor Hakkie don't get hurt.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You know what I'm going through? You think you know what Duane Barry's going through? You don't know jack!

speaker: MULDER
line: I know you're scared, Duane, and that you'd like to see this all come out right.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Yeah, right. So they can... put me back in the nuthouse... where I belong!

speaker: MULDER
line: We're only concerned about your safety, Duane. You and the others.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Hey... what's your name? Mulder? I know the routine. Honesty... containment... conciliation. Am I missing something?

speaker: MULDER
line: You need someone to trust, Duane. I know a lot of people who have been through similar experiences.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You want to do something for me, Agent Mulder? You keep your dogs on a leash. You try to gas me out or do anything stupid... These people die. They're not taking me again. You got it? They can take somebody else!

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody's going to try anything, Duane. Who is this guy? He's F.B.I., isn't he?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Former F.B.I.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you didn't think to mention that?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: He's been out of the bureau since 1982. Institutionalized on and off for over a decade. It's beside the point.

speaker: MULDER
line: The point being that the bureau wants to minimize it's embarrassment, isn't that it? That we can police our own.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: They would like it done as neatly and cleanly as possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you're off to a hell of a start.

speaker: RICH
line: Negotiation is a process, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you just wanted somebody to come down and read the script, you didn't have to bring me out.

speaker: RICH
line: This method has proven extremely successful in winning the hostage-taker's trust.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, that man is afraid. And the only way you're going to win his trust is by trying to understand what he's afraid of. Have you ever spoken to an abductee, Agent Kazdin? Heard them talk about having their brains sucked out through their nostril while being wide awake through the experience? Would you like to know what they do to a woman's ovaries?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Not particularly.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then understand that you might have to alter your approach a little bit here.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Is there anything I can do?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Yeah, what's your name again?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Krycek.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Krycek, have you got your notepad? Grande, two percent cappuccino with vanilla. Agent Rich?

speaker: REPORTER ON TV
line: ...of the hostages. As you can see, Carl, the SWAT team has taken positions on all the surrounding buildings...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's me. I'm in Virginia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I know. I've been watching it on TV. What's going on out there?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the media saying?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That an escaped mental patient is holding four people hostage in a travel agency.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what they're not telling you is that he's former F.B.I. who also claims to be an alien abductee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Seriously?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, his name's Duane Barry. Look, Scully, I need your help. I need you to find out what happened to him. Anything, transcripts from therapy sessions, hypnotic regressions... Anything about his abduction experience.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: The lights just went out here.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Stay back.

speaker: MAN #2
line: Come on, we're losing power!

speaker: SNIPER
line: What the hell is going on?

speaker: MAN #1
line: Tactical unit, what are you guys up to?

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: Nothing, absolutely nothing sir.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Ah, what the? Get down, everybody get down! Backup from command. Shots have been fired. Locate and report. I repeat, locate and report.

speaker: RICH
line: We've lost our captured line.

speaker: MAN #1
line: We have either four or five shots fired!

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the number there?

speaker: MAN #1
line: Repeat, we have either four or five shots fired!

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Our electrical substation blew. We've got no power up and down the block.

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I told you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is everybody all right, Duane?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You didn't believe me, did you?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I, I believe you. I just need to know if......anybody's been shot.

speaker: GWEN
line: I need towels. Kimberly? Kimberly? He's going to bleed to death.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I guess we're going to need a doctor.

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: Now, you'll have almost full ambient hearing loss in this ear. Your sense of balance might be affected slightly, particularly if you have to move quickly or get into a physical situation. If you get trapped or held in the building for some reason, we'll be able to warn you if there's a tactical assault. Now remember, he's either got four or five rounds left. Now, there's a wireless mic hidden in the top of this flak jacket. Speaking in a normal tone of voice, we should be able to hear anything you say up to a hundred yards. Make every attempt to keep these devices concealed. You put a normal telephone handset to that ear, it'll cause feedback and reveal that you're wired.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: You really want to do this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Your job will be to deliver medical help to the hostage. Anything else is just a bonus. You're to get in and get out. You are not to risk your own life. Whatever you believe...

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't jump into his delusion. I can't negotiate with him if he thinks I believe him.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Right. This is Agent Janus, he's a trained medic. He'll work on the hostage. You're to keep Duane Barry talking. Like I said, if he's talking, he's not going to shoot anybody including you.

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: Now, I've got three snipers out there. Anything you can do to get him to the front door, all we need is one shot to the medulla oblongata.

speaker: SNIPER
line: Tac command, this is rooftop zero-two. I have them in sight. They're passing the fountain and approaching the front entrance now.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Just unlock the door and move back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Hands in the air! Put the kit on the floor slowly.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're unarmed. We just want to help the injured.

speaker: GWEN
line: Over here.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Face the door! That's right. Not armed, huh? You're F.B.I., aren't you? Got a gun in the kit?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Are you wearing a wire?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. We're just here to help.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Okay...

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody's going to try anything, Duane.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: That's right, good. You want to work with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: We just want to make sure no one else gets hurt.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Just do your business and get out.

speaker: JANUS
line: How's he doing?

speaker: GWEN
line: He's bad.

speaker: JANUS
line: Hi, my name is Janus. I'm a paramedic. Hold on, we're going to take care of you, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: They want to work with you, Duane, but you got to work with them. Why not let the others go?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Doc's going with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then let the women go. Were they here, Duane? The light... was that them?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Don't try and B.S. Duane Barry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we lost time. I checked my watch. Isn't that what happens? Time stops. Isn't it? Duane?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You're making it up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Isn't that what they've been saying to you, Duane? That you're making it up?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They say it's all inside my head. All they want to do is just give me more drugs.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hear you, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You hear me 'cause I got a gun.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I believe your story.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: No, you're feeding into his psychosis.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know you're afraid. I know the pain and the fear you must feel.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Just listen to me. Don't try to identify with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've talked to people, Duane. People just like you, and nobody wanted to believe.

speaker: JANUS
line: This man's going to die unless we get him to a hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you let him go, Duane? There's no reason this man has to die. Come on, Duane. You've got the power. Let him go.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good. You made the right choice. Now, we're just going to move him carefully to the door.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No! Baldy can go. But you stay. I'm trading the bald man for you.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Damn it!

speaker: MAN
line: You're going to be all right, sir... just keep moving.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Now, let's see how good a liar you are.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm telling the truth, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: How could you ever know what Duane Barry's been through? How could anyone know?

speaker: MULDER
line: It happened to my sister.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Don't you think you can lie to save their lives. I want some honesty! I want some respect! I'm tired of all the B.S.!

speaker: MULDER
line: How does it happen, Duane? Driving in your car? Alone in bed at night? When do they come to you? You're paralyzed, aren't you? Unable to move. Sometimes, you can't even breathe. You feel an electric shock go through your body......and then they're there.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: He's going to push him right over the edge. I need a clear picture of what's going on in there.

speaker: MAN
line: Right away.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: You're choosing a dangerous course, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: There are beings, aren't there, Duane? Are they tall or small?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No! No!

speaker: MULDER
line: Diminutive... They take you, Duane, against your will.

speaker: GWEN
line: He's going to kill us...

speaker: MULDER
line: You're powerless. Sometimes, you can't even speak. It's always the same, nobody can help you. Where do they take you, Duane? Is there a ship? Do they take you to a ship, Duane? How do you get there? Are you conscious or being transported?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They're, uh... they're talking to Duane Barry. But they don't speak. He can hear what they're saying. They can... read his mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's right. Abductees call it "mindscan." It's a kind of telepathy.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm telling 'em I don't want to go... but they never listen. They know what I'm saying. But they just... go right on about their business. Tell him what their business is. Tell him.

speaker: MULDER
line: They take you aboard the ship to perform the tests.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They... drilled my teeth. They drilled holes in my damn teeth!

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: Yeah. Who here can talk to an Agent Scully?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Agent Scully, it's Alex Krycek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He traded himself for one of the hostages.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He's in with Duane Barry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got to get him out of there.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Well, they're working on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you've got to get him out of there now or he's going to be killed!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: How can you be sure?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because Duane Barry is not what Mulder thinks he is.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: How old was your sister when they took her?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was eight.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I've seen kids sometimes, young girls.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are they doing to them?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Doing tests. You know... testing them. I tell them not to cry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are they hurting them?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Oh, yeah. Sometimes... sometimes it hurts real bad, and uh... you just want to die, you know? You know what it's like, sir? It's like living with a gun to your head and never knowing when it's going to go off.

speaker: MULDER
line: You can let the others go, Duane. Let the others go and take me.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Oh... they heard you talking like that, they're going to have your ass.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't care about that, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: No. I wouldn't do that to you. Besides, Doc and I got an appointment. Ain't that right, Doc?

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: We got a picture. Mulder is here, opposite the doctor. The women are on the north wall. We can't see the east wall, Duane Barry must be there.

speaker: MAN
line: Hold on a second.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I don't think you understand what I'm telling you. I just flew down here from Washington...

speaker: MAN
line: We, we got a situation in progress...

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, well then let me speak to someone who's in charge.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You are. Calm down, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't tell me to calm down, I'm not going to calm down until I can talk to someone who will listen to what I'm saying!

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: What's the problem here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Special Agent Dana Scully and I have information that is vital to your negotiations.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: What information?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think there has been a critical misjudgment here. This man who claims to be under the control of aliens, his, his mental health history describes a rare state of psychosis. As you can see from his medical records, in 1982, Duane Barry was shot in the line of duty, the bullet piercing his bilateral frontal lobes.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The injury left him nearly incapable of functioning in society. It effectively destroyed the moral center of his brain. Now, almost a hundred years ago, there was a famous case. A man named Gage had a blasting rod pierce the same region.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: And what effect did it have?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He became a pathological liar, suffering from severe delusions. His behavior was characterized as bizarre and violent with a tendency to act out his fantasies.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: How did you get involved in this case?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder called me. We used to work together.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Well, if this is true, he's got your former partner completely fooled.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there a way I can reach him with this information?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: The government knows about it, you know. They're even in on it sometimes. Right there in the room when they come. They work together with a, uh, secret, uh, corporation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who in the government?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: A man, the military. They're all in it together. The government knows why they're here, but they wouldn't dare let the truth out. So they cooperate.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're going to have to deal with resolving this situation, Duane... sooner or later.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I'm tired.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's no other way out. You've got to tell them what you want to do.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I just want to go back to the place.

speaker: MULDER
line: What place?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Where it first started. Where they first came and got me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is that?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: A mountain. We went, uh, up... and up. Ascending... ascending to the stars. I'm not going again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? It's me. Listen to me. You cannot trust Duane Barry. He is a brain-damaged psychopath who took a bullet in the head. He is not what you think he is.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: How do they find you each time?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Implants... my gums, sinus cavities...... and my belly button. Tracking devices.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he could snap at any time. He has a history of irrational and violent behavior. Now, you have to work towards resolving this. Now, you have his trust. You have to try and negotiate with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not let the women go, Duane? They'll deal with you if you let the women go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's good, that's good, Mulder. Now keep him talking. H.R.T. is moving into position and unless you can get him to free the hostages, they're going to execute a tactical plan.

speaker: MULDER
line: The women are of no consequence to you. Let them go. It's the right thing to do, Duane.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Okay, but he stays. Go on, get out of here. Get up, go on. Get out of here, go on.

speaker: KIMBERLY
line: I'm... I just want to say that I believe you.

speaker: SNIPER
line: The women are clear.

speaker: MAN
line: I got him, standing, center room... moving...

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the countdown, Mulder, they're coming at you.

speaker: MARKSMAN #1
line: Position number one, ready.

speaker: TACTICAL COMMANDER
line: Coming at you, number one.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: We're going to need transportation.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you want, Duane? A car?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know where you want to go?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: They're going to tell me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane, you can't leave here if you don't know where you want to go. Duane!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come here.

speaker: MAN
line: Hold your fire, you lost your line.

speaker: MULDER
line: There... there's something I want to ask you.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You didn't believe me. I had to earn your trust. Now, there's something I got to know. Are you making any of this up?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You are... calling Duane Barry a liar now?

speaker: MULDER
line: No...

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You think I make it all up.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I don't. I'm sorry.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You're sorry?

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane, will you listen to me for a second?

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You're just like all the others, aren't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane...

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You say you believe me...

speaker: MULDER
line: Duane, I do believe you.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: ...but you don't!

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe you!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: You lie just like everybody else!

speaker: MULDER
line: No! I believe you, Duane!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: I trusted you! I trusted you like a fool!

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I say... can I say something? Duane, can I say something? I know you're tired, but there's something you've forgotten to do. When you let the women leave, you left the door unlocked. Go lock the door, Duane. Go lock the door. Go lock the door, Duane. Go lock it. They could get in here. Go lock the door.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Let's go, let's move!

speaker: MAN #2
line: Okay, come on.

speaker: MAN #1
line: He's down, he's down, he's down!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whatever you're feeling... you did the right thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's just that, uh... I believed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sometimes when you want to believe so badly, you end up... looking too hard.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Agent Mulder, thanks for coming.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I was surprised to get your call.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Yeah, well... as it turned out, whatever your impression of the way it was handled, I didn't get to thank you for going out there and putting it on the line. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, I guess I thought maybe you called me down here to chew me out. How's he doing?

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: Duane? They almost lost him, but he stabilized. They got him listed on critical. I checked on his records with the bureau. It was exemplary. His accident was something of a mystery. Shot by his own weapon in a drug stakeout, left for dead in the woods. He was never the same. Lost everything... wife, kids, house...

speaker: MULDER
line: The fine thread of sanity.

speaker: LUCY KAZDIN
line: I actually called you down here for another reason, Agent Mulder. Uh... in the x-rays, the surgeon found several pieces of metal. In his gums, in his sinus cavity, and one in the abdomen. I had them checked, I felt you'd want to know... and there were tiny drill holes in his left and right rear molars. A dentist who examined them said they could not have been done with any of the current equipment in use... not without chipping or damaging the tooth. Anyway... I thought you ought to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This could just be a piece of shrapnel. Duane Barry did a tour of duty in Vietnam.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was right where he said it would be, Scully. Along with the ones in his gums and sinus.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you think that this was implanted?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if it was, that would mean Duane Barry is telling the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or some version of the truth. Look, I'll, I'll take this down to ballistics. We can have this cleared up in a second.

speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
line: Let me just make a slight adjustment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think?

speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
line: Could be a shell casing or a small artillery fragment. The edges are dull, but it could have been white-hot when it entered the body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That would make sense.

speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
line: But look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
line: These small markings. See them here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. Looks like some kind of a stamp.

speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
line: Like it's been tooled or etched. Pretty fine work, too. This square we're looking at is only ten microns across. Strange.

speaker: CLERK
line: Eleven fourteen. Thank you.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Excuse me, can I get some help here with these?

speaker: CLERK
line: I'll, uh, be right with you. I just have to cash out my drawer. What happened? Did you touch something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, I don't know what happened.

speaker: POLICE OFFICER
line: All right...

speaker: MULDER ON MACHINE
line: Hello, this is Fox Mulder. Leave a message please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I just had something incredibly strange happen. This piece of metal that they took out of Duane Barry, it has some kind of a code on it. I ran it through a scanner and some kind of a serial number came up. What the hell is this thing, Mulder? It's almost as if... it's almost as if somebody was using it to catalogue him.

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Come on, lady...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: DUANE BARRY
line: Come on!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need your help! Mulder! Mulder!
